question.text: When we say 'Java', what can we mean by it?
Java is a cross platform programming language.
What does cross platform mean?
question.answer: You have to compile your program for each platform you want it to support.
You programs will run in multiple environments, operation systems.
Your programs are guaranteed to run on Linux.

question.text: Which corporation take or took part in the development of Java?
Java is currently owned by Sun Microsystems.
Java is currently owned by the Oracle Corporation.
The Java platform is designed in a way so that only one programming language, Java, can use it.
Select what is not part of the Java platform!
Select what is part of the Java platform!
What is the JDK
question.answer: An implementation of the Java platform
A programming language based on Java.

question.text: What does JDK stand for?
What does JVM stand for?
What does IDE stand for?
What is the purpose of the JVM?
question.answer: Contains the specifications for the Java platform.

question.text: Which properties are true for the Java programming language?
question.answer: It can only be executed over Windows OS.

question.text: .java files are text files.
Only the JVM may open .java files.
Are there any restrictions on naming .java files.
question.answer: The name of file must match the name of the public class inside it.
The file names can't contain capital letters.
The file name must begin with an underscore.

question.text: .class files contain bytecode
The JVM can execute .java files.
The JVM can execute .class files.
What is true about .class files?
question.asnwer: The Java compiler creates them from .java files.

question.text: What is the file extension of a Java source file?
What is the file extension of compiled Java source file, containing bytecode?
What is the file extension of a Java archive?
What is a Java archive?
question.answer: A collection of Java source files.
A compressed file containing data for a Java application.

question.text: JAR files can be made executable.
What is the purpose of packages?
question.answer: They separate compiled and not compiled Java files.
They are used to organize our classes by their function.
They give the structure of a project.

question.text: Packages are not allowed to contain other packages.
Which package names are restricted?
The package declaration line must always be the last line of the source file.
There must always be a package declaration line in the source file, on the first line.
We would like to import a class named 'Utils' from package 'calculator', which is inside package 'com'. What is the import line we must write?
We are creating a class into package 'utils', which is inside package 'org'. What is the package declaration statement we must write?
Using the default package is discouraged.
What is true about the main method?
question.answer: Every Java program must have this method.
It's the entry point of the application

question.text: What does application entry point mean?
question.answer: It's where the compiler starts compiling your source files.
The first line of the source file.
It's where the JVM will start to execute your program.
It's the only method with no return type.

question.text: Write the statement that will print 'Good morning' to the console.
Enter the statement that will print 'ABC' to the console.
The statement 'System.out.println(Hello, world!);' is valid.
The statement 'System.out.println("Hello, world!");' is valid.
What is true about statement execution?
question.answer: Inside a method, statements are executed from bottom to top.
The statements are executed in the order they were compiled in.
Inside a method, statements are executed from top to bottom.

question.text: Java is statically typed.
What does statically typed mean?
question.answer: Variables can only have a few different types.
When declaring a variable, we must say its type, and this type can't be changed.
We don't need to say a variables type when declaring it.
Every variable must have a unique identifier, a name.

question.text: We must initialize our variable in the same statement it was declared in.
Something is missing from the variable declaration 'int x = 5' Write the corrected statement.
Something is wrong with the 'String data = 32;' statement. Write the corrected statement, without changing the variables name, or value.
Something is wrong with the 'String text "my message";' statement. Write the corrected statement, without changing the variables name, or value.
Which operator is used to check equality?
What does this statement do: 'int data = 21;'
question.answer: Declares an integer variable called 'data', and initializes it with value 21.
Declares a data variable called 'int', and initializes it with value 21.
Checks if the variable 'data' is equal to 21.
This statement is invalid, it won't do anything.

question.text: What does this statement do: 'String input;'
question.answer: Declares a String variable called 'input' and initializes it to the users input.
This statement is invalid, it won't do anything.

question.text: If we assign a value with with a different type to a variable, the variable will update its type.
What is a type mismatch?
question.answer: The variable and it's assigned value have different types.
Not giving a type to our variable.
When the compiler doesn't recognize the variable type we wrote.
Not having a main method in our program.

question.text: One statement can only declare one variable.
It is possible to declare 4 variables with a single statement.
Is the 'String i1 = "i_1", i2 = "i_2";' statement valid?
What is true integer variables?
question.answer: We can perform basic arithmetic like +, -, or * on them.

question.text: What is true about String variables?
question.answer: Their values can be printed to the console.
We can use the '+' operator on them to connect them together.
They must be printed in the same method they were declared in.

question.text: Which of these are needed to declare a method?
question.answer: Writing the method name in the main method.
A return type for the method.
A list of parameters, each with their own type and identifier.

question.text: All methods except the main method must return a value.
If a method doesn't return a value, we don't have to write anything instead of the return type.
If a method doesn't have parameters we don't have to write anything inside the parameter's parentheses.
What is true about methods?
question.answer: Any method will contain at least one return statement.
All of them must return a value.
There are methods without any parameters.

question.text: Which of these is not true about methods?
question.answer: The lack of return type is indicated by the 'void' keyword.
Each parameter must have its own identifier.
If a method has no parameters, it must return a value.
Each parameter must have its own type.

question.text: Write the keyword that indicates that the method has no return type.

What would you write between the parentheses if you declare a method with two parameters. The first one is an integer with the name 'amount', the second is a string with the name 'name'. Don't write the parentheses.
What would you write between the parentheses if you declare a method with two parameters. They are both integers with the names 'num1' and 'num2'. Don't write the parentheses.
Which keyword is used to return value to the caller in methods?
We would like to return the variable called 'determinant'. What statement must we write?
The return statement must be the first statement in the method.
The return statement must be the last statement that is executed in the method.
Every method must have a return statement.
What is true about the return statement?
question.answer: The main method must have at least one return statement.
Methods with no return type can have a return statement.
Methods with no return type must have a return statement.
All return statements must contain a variable name as well.

question.text: Which of these we must write when calling a method?
question.answer: The return type of the method.
The parameters, between parentheses. We must write the parentheses even if there are no parameters.
The parameters, between parentheses. we don't need to write the parentheses if there are no parameters.

question.text: Assuming that the 'compute' methods has integer return type, the statement 'int x = compute();' is valid.
Assuming that the 'compute' methods has integer return type, the statement 'String x = compute();' is valid.
Assuming that the 'executeTask' methods has no return type, the statement 'int res = executeTask();' is valid.
Select the characters which can be the first character in an identifier.
Select the characters which can't be the first character in an identifier.
Identifiers can't be longer then 100 characters.
'_myVar' is a valid identifier.
'9lives' is an invalid identifier.
'my_(well_named)_variable' is a valid identifier
Write 'web socket' using the camel case notation.
Write 'insert to end' using the camel case notation.
Write 'remove all' using the camel case notation.
We would like to name a method which adds an element to a list. Which of these would be the best naming choice (using java conventions)?
We would like to name a variable which stores a prime number. Which of these would be the best naming choice (using java conventions)?
We would like to name a class related to matrices. Which of these would be the best naming choice (using java conventions)?
We would like to name a package which contains database related classes. Which of these would be the best naming choice (using java conventions)?
We would like to name constant to store the value of the speed of light. Which of these would be the best naming choice (using java conventions)?
Write a single line comment which says 'this is a comment'.
Write a single line comment which says 'remember to comment your code!'.
Write a multi line comment (in one line) which says 'important information'.
Which symbols are used to create multi-lined comments?
